intro: Bulbocodium requienii, commonly known as the Canary Islands sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple ray flowers. The plant grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and windy conditions. It has a bulbous base that helps it store water and nutrients. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
